meanings.definition: To cause to occur or operate at the same time
meanings.sent1: The dancers synchronised their movements perfectly during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The traffic lights in the city are synchronised to help with traffic flow.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized clucking of the chickens made the farmer chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Their hearts synchronised like a well-rehearsed orchestra, beating in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized swimmers moved as one, creating a mesmerizing display of unity.

meanings.definition: To occur at the same time or rate
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display was synchronised with the music for a spectacular show.
meanings.sent2: The two clocks in the room synchronised perfectly, chiming together every hour.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized chirping of the birds outside seemed like a natural alarm clock.
meanings.sent4: Their footsteps synchronised as they walked side by side, creating a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent5: The waves on the shore and the seagulls' cries seemed to synchronise in a peaceful rhythm.
